text: Following the row selection post from last week, this week I have covered column selection rules: <https://bkamins.github.io/julialang/2021/02/06/colsel.html>

attachments.title: Column selectors in DataFrames.jl
attachments.fallback: Blog by Bogumił Kamiński: Column selectors in DataFrames.jl

elements.text: Following the row selection post from last week, this week I have covered column selection rules:

text:
> Additionally you can pass a type as a second argument to the `names` function, and in this case you will get a vector of column names whose element type is a subtype of passed argument.
:exploding_head:

elements.text: Additionally you can pass a type as a second argument to the
function, and in this case you will get a vector of column names whose element type is a subtype of passed argument.

text: Thanks for this, was wondering the `df.column` way is not mentioned and I use this one quite often to create new columns? I like this because its like R's `df$column` and pandas `df.column` .  Just wanna make sure it won't be deprecated since I do this often.
